org.opends.server.backends.jeb.importLDIF

Class IndexOutputBuffer

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.opends.server.backends.jeb.importLDIF.IndexOutputBuffer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Comparable<IndexOutputBuffer>

    public final class IndexOutputBuffer
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Comparable<IndexOutputBuffer>
    This class represents a index buffer used to store the keys and entry IDs processed from the LDIF file during phase one of an import, or rebuild index process. Each key and ID is stored in a record in the buffer. The records in the buffer are eventually sorted, based on the key, when the maximum size of the buffer is reached and no more records will fit into the buffer. The buffer is the scheduled to be flushed to an indexes scratch file and then re-cycled by the import, or rebuild-index process. The records are packed as much as possible, to optimize the buffer space. This class is not thread safe.

      Interface that defines two methods used to compare keys used in this class.

      • isPoison

        public boolean isPoison()
        Determines if a buffer is a poison buffer. A poison buffer is used to shutdown work queues when import/rebuild index phase one is completed. A poison buffer has a 0 size.
        Returns:
        true if a buffer is a poison buffer, or false otherwise.

      • isDiscard

        public boolean isDiscard()
        Determines of a buffer should be re-cycled.
        Returns:
        true if buffer should be recycled, or false if it should not.

      • compare

        public boolean compare(byte[] b,
              int bIndexID)
        Compare the byte array at the current position with the specified one and using the specified index id. It will return true if the byte array at the current position is equal to the specified byte array as determined by the comparator and the index ID is is equal. It will return false otherwise.
        Parameters:
        b - The byte array to compare.
        bIndexID - The index key.
        Returns:
        True if the byte arrays are equal.

      • compareTo

        public int compareTo(IndexOutputBuffer b)
        Compare current IndexBuffer to the specified index buffer using both the comparator and index ID of both buffers. The key at the value of position in both buffers are used in the compare.
        Specified by:
        compareTo in interface java.lang.Comparable<IndexOutputBuffer>
        Parameters:
        b - The IndexBuffer to compare to.
        Returns:
        0 if the buffers are equal, -1 if the current buffer is less than the specified buffer, or 1 if it is greater.
